ranked_diseases.explanation: Rett Syndrome is associated with intellectual disability and delayed speech and language development, particularly in individuals assigned female at birth. Although more common in females, it can occasionally occur in males with a more severe phenotype.
Fragile X Syndrome frequently presents with intellectual disability and delayed speech. This condition is more prevalent in males but can also affect females to varying degrees.
Angelman Syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability, delayed development, and severe speech impairment. This syndrome can affect both genders.
Smith-Magenis Syndrome is associated with intellectual disability and speech delays among other behavioral symptoms. It affects both genders and can present similarly to the phenotypic features.
